title: How did ideas concerning sea power change during the age of sail? - Quora

response.answer_text: They evolved more properly speaking as the major sea faring nations of that age like Britain, Spain, Netherlands, France and Portugal sought the wealth, land, commodities and control of the New World, the Americas and the Far East that only sail power might grant them. Sea power in support of New World discovery and trade became the objective as opposed to achieving military or naval superiority alone. The latter followed in the 18th Century given that after 1588 and defeat of Spain’s Armada no navy would seriously challenge Britain again until the Battle of Trafalgar.
